title: Mount Valin
text:
Mount Valin is the highest <a href="mountain">mountain</a> of the <a href="Saguenay%E2%80%93Lac-Saint-Jean">Saguenay–Lac-Saint-Jean</a> region (as measured from <a href="sea%20level">sea level</a>) in the <a href="Canada">Canadian</a> province of <a href="Quebec">Quebec</a>. Situated from <a href="Chicoutimi">Chicoutimi</a>, the mountain receives an average of of rain and of snow every year.
Mount Valin is an important site used for transmission facilities for radio and television stations in the region. Stations broadcasting from Mount Valin are television stations <a href="CFRS-DT">CFRS-DT</a>, <a href="CKTV-DT">CKTV-DT</a> and <a href="T%C3%A9l%C3%A9-Qu%C3%A9bec">CIVV-DT</a>; and radio stations <a href="CFIX-FM">CFIX-FM</a>, <a href="CJAB-FM">CJAB-FM</a> and <a href="CION-FM">CION-FM-2</a>.
Mount Valin is part of the <a href="Monts-Valin%20National%20Park">Monts-Valin National Park</a> and home to the Le Valinouët ski centre.
